Ingredients.4: 1 pound small Gulf shrimp (50 to 60 per pound), thawed and drained

Ingredients.7: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.8: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste

Ingredients.9: 50  large (restaurant-style) tortilla chips, or as needed

Ingredients.10: 2  jalapeno peppers, seeded and very thinly sliced

Ingredients.11: 1.5 cups shredded pepperjack cheese, or as needed

Ingredients.12: 15  cherry tomatoes, sliced - or as needed

Directions.1: Combine sour cream, avocado, and lemon juice in a blender or food processor; blend until smooth and creamy. Transfer into a plastic decorating bottle with a long tip. Refrigerate avocado-cream sauce until needed.

Directions.2: Place shrimp into a bowl; combine with vegetable oil, ground chipotle pepper, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.

Directions.3: Place a large nonstick pan over high heat. Cook shrimp in the hot pan in a single layer until barely cooked through and pink, about 1 minute per side. Transfer to a plate and let shrimp cool.

Directions.4: Preheat the oven's broiler. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and lightly grease the foil.

Directions.5: Lay tortilla chips onto the prepared baking sheet in a single layer. Place 1 shrimp onto each chip. Add 1 slice jalapeno and 1 large pinch pepperjack cheese on top of each shrimp.

Directions.6: Broil under preheated broiler until cheese is melted and chips are lightly toasted, about 1 minute. Watch carefully; chips will burn quickly.

Directions.7: Remove nachos from baking sheet and arrange onto a serving platter; drizzle with avocado-cream sauce and sprinkle with cherry tomatoes and cilantro before serving.
